caption: Good drinks. Simple food menu, not overly complicated. The avocado line salad is tasty, however, it is not filling. The grilled cheese and tomato soup did not lack for taste, but needed more cheese in the sandwich and soup in the bowl lol. Still a nice time. I will be going back again.

I have been to Lulu's twice because it has a lot to offer during the pandemic with a large patio and heaters.  Food is ordered via the app and payment is made after each order is placed, so pay after each round of drinks etc...  Servers just come out and drop off the food and leave.  The first time we went was in November and my crew thought the hostess was  unfriendly because of how strict she was when explaining the rules, but I wrote it off to early stages of cold weather pandemic, so just cautious. I went  this month with 2 friends and same structure and I think the same hostess.  They have a 2 hour dining limit and they warn you 20 minutes before your time is up.  We had a 6pm-8pm reservation and she approached us at  7:50pm and said "I need you to leave the table now" because she seated the first person at 5:50pm.  We left what food was on our plate and half full glasses of wine.  When I approached her on the way out that we still had 10 minutes and could have finished our food and wine she stuck to her rule that 2 hours started at 5:5pm and gave a flippant sorry and would you like to us pour your wine back in the bottle and take it with you. She then  turned towards the bar and rolled her eyes. We probably spent $200 and walked out pretty ticked off that we couldn't finish the wine and she wouldn't reseat us at one of the other patio tables that were empty.  Food is pretty good, but not enough to warrant the treatment from the hostess.  That type of treatment of customers can only be achieved at the best restaurants in DC.

If possible, I would rate Lulu’s Wine Garden 3.5 stars. The outdoor ambiance and service were remarkable while the cocktails were decent (Paid Vacation and Rum Horchata). However, the pork belly pastrami sandwich was sub-par as the meat was very tough and difficult to chew.

*COVID REVIEW*  From self-seating to contactless ordering through a QR code to well-spaced seating with heaters, Lulu's has one of the most comfortable COVID setups I have ever seen, especially in its primo location. Totally reasonable that they ask you to order food alongside a drink too.  A downside for me was how few by-the-glass wine options they had which surprised me considering it's a wine bar.

Overall had a good time and they offer indoor or outside seating.  Would not recommend the mixed drinks as they are not well prepared - probably my fault for ordering mixed drinks at a wine bar, but they did offer it and it wasn’t to standard.  The food is delicious and perfect for sharing.
Great place, food is delicious.  I loved the Zero Hot Horchata, Fluffy pancakes, Queso and Chips.  Staff is friendly, good music, great vibes!
Great place to visit during the pandemic.  Great food, Great Drinks
Great outside seating with lots of drink options.
Great atmosphere and amazing wine list bottles are priced the same so you can choose a bunch good deals and staff are very informative

Good food, affordable wine, excellent vibe & atmosphere. We sat on the adorable outdoor patio which had heaters. Sadly we didn't love either of the 2 wine bottles we got though.  COVID REVIEW There are basically no servers. (It would have been nice if we had a server that talked to us about them and recommended wines.) With COVID they're doing contactless menu that you have to use to put in your order. It's pretty annoying and definitely gets in the way of enjoying dinner.
Lovely quiet back patio, flavorful cocktails and food.
Great outdoor patio, and great service! The wine and food were all great.
Food was great! Ilija, the waiter was great! The manager checked on us, which means they value their clients!
Food is phenomenal, service outstanding and location centric. Will come back for more! Highly recommend their non-boozy lime julip. 🤤
The outdoor seating is nice. The food was okay but definitely overpriced.
Had a great experience sitting on their back patio. The environment was just what we were looking for, food was awesome, and the drinks were reasonably priced.

Excellent food, great drinks and fantastic service. Lulu's is being very thoughtful in the safety of their guests and staff during this time. We felt very safe sitting on the patio that was spaced out and had fans. The host explained how to use the QR code and we were easily able to order our food and drink through the website.

The atmosphere here is great. They have lots of cool cocktails to choose from and cater to a variety of tastes. Their wine list is good as well. The ambiance is unique-- you feel like you've left the city and entered a private garden- which I assume is what they're going for. The only thing that I would say is that I wish they had more food options for vegans. The mushroom toast was good, but if it's the only option that I can order, I'm not going to hurry back considering ordering food is mandatory. I also wish we had more personalized service as everything is done through an app due to COVID, so I couldn't express this to anyone when I was there. Nonetheless, I enjoyed my visit and understand we are living in difficult times.

Lulu's has become a quick favorite for us. The service is great (even in a COVID world) and the food and drinks are always on point. Hands down the best queso that we've ever had. The chicken sandwich and avocado lime caesar salad are also great. If you want a cocktail instead wine, I highly recommend the Est. 1930! We've been a handful of times and also gotten takeout, and they have exceeded our expectations every time.

The entire place is decorated so nicely. The back patio is my favorite. This is an absolute great spot to come and grab a bite to eat while trying one of their delicious cocktails then getting a bottle of wine to split with friends. (I love the frozen Aperol cocktail and the whipped feta!)

Lulu’s is an utter delight! I’ve been twice since the city opened up and felt very safe dining outside. I’ve set in both their front patio area and back courtyard and the design and aesthetics are beautiful and hip! Really great cocktails and friendly staff.
The patio outside was very nice and well arranged for this pandemic. Everything was contactless and smooth. Music was great
Easy ordering during COVID and comfortable outdoor seating. Cocktails were good, wine was a little over priced at $12 for a 5oz pour.

Fantastic new addition! Broad selection of delicious wines and ohhhh....the food. Everything from light and flavorful veggie dish through an incredible chicken sandwich (Popeyes no chance) and a rich, warm pork belly pastrami sandwich. Do yourself a favor and get here fast, no doubt long lines will be forming soon.
